docs.snippet: As Hideki Matsui and Donovan McNabb illustrated this week, the one-day contract has become a rite of passage for modern athletes — a select few, anyway — before they retreat from the spotlight....
docs.lead_paragraph: As Hideki Matsui and Donovan McNabb illustrated this week, the one-day contract has become a rite of passage for modern athletes — a select few, anyway — before they retreat from the spotlight.
docs.abstract: One-day contract is a rite of passage that gives retired star athletes a final chance to return to the teams they were most identified with in their careers; former New York Yankees pitcher Hideki Matsui, who retired in 2012, and Philadelphia Eagles' Donovan McNabb, retired since 2011, both sign fresh contracts with their former teams for the sole purpose of coming out of retirement for a final day of accolades.

headline.main: The One-Day Contract, a Last Hurrah for Athletes

docs.snippet: The Detroit Tigers know what's coming, so they went out and got themselves a new shortstop for the rest of the season. The Yankees know, too, though they don't seem nearly as concerned about their upcoming loss....
